intro: Sessea petiolaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sesse, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, narrow leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Sessea petiolaris is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
